Articles.Content:
So i was casually playing ksp, blowing stuff up, getting science. I had just landed a cockpit on kerbin when the game crashed. After launching the game again and getting back to the cockpit strange things started to happen.

I could keep on clicking EVA and new jebs kept popping out until the hatch was obstructed.

Yup, they're clones.

Quick timewarp and the capsule jumped to another dimension.

Maybe if i try to reload from the tracking station

NOPE. IT WONT FIX IT!

OH GOD SOMEONE HELP ME!

AHHHHHHH!!! They are just floating there!!

Reload attempt 2. everything seems to be OK.

What.

Its starting again!!

Congratioulations, there's no more room in hell.

That was a new experience for me. And just so you know i couldnt move the kerbals, they behaved like solid objects. even though some of them looked like this
Looks like a quest for danny the bug finder.
not the first time this has happened to somebody.... not sure what caused it though as its not common enough and near impossible to replicate.
Oh my Kerbal, I'm laughing so hard at those Jeb Stretchmans that my stomach hurt.
why isnt this a normal game feature yet? update .24 needs to be "the infinite stretchy jeb update" so everyone can do this.

Looks like a quest for danny the bug finder.

Danny is not a bug finder, he just plays KSP a lot and finds a lot of bugs because of that. He uses the bugs to make youtube videos.
